UniprotID	Q9NUL3-6
Accession	Q9NUL3;A0A0A0MTC5;B7Z1I6;B7Z292;B7Z8B4;E7ER74;E9PEI3;E9PF26;E9PF50;Q6AHY7;Q96HM0;Q96HM1;Q9NVI5;Q9UGG6
EntryName	STAU2_HUMAN
ProteinName	Double-stranded RNA-binding protein Staufen homolog 2
GeneName	STAU2
Length	398
Function	RNA-binding protein required for the microtubule-dependent transport of neuronal RNA from the cell body to the dendrite. As protein synthesis occurs within the dendrite, the localization of specific mRNAs to dendrites may be a prerequisite for neurite outgrowth and plasticity at sites distant from the cell body (By similarity).
Subcellular Location	Cytoplasm; Nucleus; Nucleus; Nucleolus; Endoplasmic reticulum
Disorder	
ExposeBuried	
SurfaceAccessbility	
SecondStructure	
Hydropathy	
Polar	
Charge
